Info.title: 大學機構典藏推展之策略與實踐:以國立政治大學圖書館為例

Abstract:
Many academic libraries are often faced with the challenge of developing and
popularizing the use of an institutional repository. This paper discusses the various issues
associated with providing repository services, and explores the current strategies and 
organizational activities employed by libraries when introducing them. It presents the
experiences and results of the National Chengchi University libraries in handling the tasks
of institutional repository development, promotion, and marketing
Keywords: Institutional repository; Archive policy; Academic libraries; Preservation service; Use promotion

General Computer Science.reason: While not deeply technical, the paper touches on general concepts related to information management and system implementation, which fall under the umbrella of general computer science.

Computer Science (miscellaneous).reason: This is a broad category that can encompass aspects of the paper that don't neatly fit into other specific domains. The overall management and strategy aspects of repository development could be considered miscellaneous.

Artificial Intelligence.reason: The abstract and keywords do not suggest any AI involvement.

Computational Theory and Mathematics.reason: The abstract and keywords do not suggest any theoretical or mathematical involvement.

Computer Graphics and Computer-Aided Des.reason: The abstract and keywords do not suggest any involvement of computer graphics or CAD.

Computer Networks and Communications.reason: While repositories are accessed over networks, the paper doesn't focus on networking aspects themselves.

Computer Science Applications.reason: Institutional repositories are a specific application of computer science principles to manage and disseminate academic information.

Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition.reason: The abstract and keywords do not suggest any involvement of computer vision or pattern recognition.

Hardware and Architecture.reason: The paper doesn't focus on the underlying hardware or system architecture of the repository.

Human-Computer Interaction.reason: The paper might implicitly touch upon HCI through use promotion, but it's not a central theme.

Information Systems.reason: Institutional repositories are fundamentally information systems designed for storage, retrieval, and preservation of digital assets. This is a core aspect of the paper.

Signal Processing.reason: The abstract and keywords do not suggest any involvement of signal processing.

Software.reason: Repositories are software systems. The development, promotion, and maintenance of these systems are relevant.
